metadata.key_specifications: 36V unidirectional TVS protection diode, ±30kV ESD protection, 41A (8/20µs) surge protection, 50V clamping voltage at 25A (8/20µs), low 1µA max leakage current, -55°C to +150°C temp range, SOT-23 package
metadata.applications: I/O Protection, Power Line Protection, Body Electronics & Lighting, Hybrid, Electric, & Powertrain Systems

page_summaries.content:
TSM36A-Q1 Automotive Surge Protection Device in SOT-23 Package
1 Features
• ISO 10605 (330pF, 330Ω) ESD protection:
– ±30kV contact discharge
– ±30kV air gap discharge
• IEC61000-4-5 surge protection:
– 41A (8/20µs)
– Clamping voltage: 50V at 25A (8/20µs)
• Low leakage current: 1µA (maximum)
• Temperature range: -55°C to +150°C
• AEC-Q101 qualified
• Leaded package used for automatic optical inspection (AOI)
2 Applications
• I/O Protection
• Power Line Protection
• Body Electronics & Lighting
• Hybrid, Electric, & Powertrain Systems
3 Description
The TSM36A-Q1 is a 36V, unidirectional TVS protection diode designed for clamping harmful transients such as ESD and surge. The TSM36A-Q1 robustly shunts up to 41A of IEC 61000-4-5 fault current to protect systems from high power transients or lightning strikes.
Additionally, the TSM36A-Q1 is available in a small leaded SOT-23 (DBZ) package which is reduced in size by approximately 50 percent compared to the industry standard SMA package. The extremely low device leakage and capacitance ensures a minimal effect on the protected line.

4 Pin Configuration and Functions
1GND
2GND
3 IO
Not to scale
Figure 4-1. DBZ Package, 3-Pin SOT-23 (Top View)
Table 4-1. Pin Functions
PIN
TYPE(1) DESCRIPTION
NAME NO.
IO 3 I/O Surge and ESD protected IO
GND 1, 2 G Connect to ground. To achieve the rated performance, it is required to connect pin 1 and 2 together on the PCB as close to the device as possible.
(1) I = Input, O = Output, I/O = Input or Output, G = Ground, P = Power

The TSM36A-Q1 is a diode type TVS that provides a path to ground for dissipating transient voltage spikes, such as ESD or surge, on signal lines and power lines. Connect the device in parallel to the down stream circuitry for protection. As the current from the transient passes through the device, only a small voltage drop is present across the diode. This is the voltage presented to the protected IC. The low R DYN of the triggered TVS holds this voltage (VCLAMP) to a safe level for the protected IC.

Product Summary.content: TSM36A-Q1 is an Automotive Surge Protection Device in SOT-23 Package. It provides ESD protection up to ±30kV contact/air gap discharge and IEC61000-4-5 surge protection up to 41A (8/20µs) with a clamping voltage of 50V at 25A (8/20µs). It has low leakage current of 1µA (maximum) and a wide temperature range of -55°C to +150°C.

The TSM36A-Q1 is a 36V, unidirectional TVS protection diode designed for clamping harmful transients such as ESD and surge. It robustly shunts up to 41A of IEC 61000-4-5 fault current to protect systems from high power transients or lightning strikes. It is suitable for applications like I/O Protection, Power Line Protection, Body Electronics & Lighting, and Hybrid, Electric, & Powertrain Systems.

The TSM36A-Q1 is available in a small leaded SOT-23 (DBZ) package which is reduced in size by approximately 50 percent compared to the industry standard SMA package. It has extremely low device leakage and capacitance, ensuring a minimal effect on the protected line. The device is AEC-Q101 qualified and the leaded package is used for automatic optical inspection (AOI).

Application Circuits.content: The TSM36A-Q1 is a diode type TVS (Transient Voltage Suppressor) that provides a path to ground for dissipating transient voltage spikes, such as ESD (Electrostatic Discharge) or surge, on signal lines and power lines.

Connect the TSM36A-Q1 device in parallel to the downstream circuitry for protection. As the current from the transient passes through the device, only a small voltage drop is present across the diode. This small voltage drop is the voltage presented to the protected IC.
The low R_DYN (dynamic resistance) of the triggered TVS holds the voltage across the protected IC (VCLAMP) to a safe level, protecting the IC from transient voltage spikes.
